title: [BUG] FBProphet causes an issue if exogenous X already contains a column named ds
body:
**Describe the bug**
<!--
A clear and concise description of what the bug is.
-->
As discussed in PR https://github.com/alan-turing-institute/sktime/pull/1711: 
If the series passed does have the` ds `column, the forecaster raises an error, which it shouldn't. 

**To Reproduce**
<!--
Add a Minimal, Complete, and Verifiable example (for more details, see e.g. https://stackoverflow.com/help/mcve

If the code is too long, feel free to put it in a public gist and link it in the issue: https://gist.github.com
-->

```python
from sktime.forecasting.fbprophet import Prophet
import pandas as pd
import numpy as np

y_train = pd.Series(np.arange(1,21), index=pd.date_range(start='1/1/2021', end='20/1/2021'))
X_train = pd.DataFrame(data=np.arange(1,21), columns=['ds'], index=pd.date_range(start='1/1/2021', end='20/1/2021'))

arima_forecaster = Prophet()
arima_forecaster.fit_predict(fh=y_train.index, y=y_train, X=X_train)
print(X_train)
```
**Error Thrown**
`ValueError: Column name 'ds' is reserved in fbprophet`

**Expected behavior**
<!--
A clear and concise description of what you expected to happen.
-->
The forecaster should not throw an error in this case

**Additional Context**

In https://github.com/alan-turing-institute/sktime/pull/1711, there were two approaches suggested to solve this issue:
First by @fkiraly 
- write a functions df_to_prophet which takes X and does not have any side effects on it.
- df_to_prophet moves index of X to ds column. If a ds column is already present, it renames it to a name that doesn't exist yet in the columns. For instance, the longest column name plus an underscore or similar.
- the function is applied whenever X is passed.

Second approach would be not renaming the column. I am not sure how to handle the issue in this case.



<!-- Thanks for contributing! -->
